Title: All of Us Strangers
Description: A lonely screenwriter develops an intimate relationship with his mysterious neighbour while his past returns to life.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy is a genre of speculative fiction which involves themes of the supernatural, magic, and imaginary worlds and creatures.

Director.Name: Andrew Haigh
Director.Bio: Andrew Haigh is an English filmmaker who was born in Harrogate and studied at Newcastle University.

Title: Moonlight
Description: The film presents three stages in the life of the main character: his childhood, adolescence, and early adult life. It explores the difficulties he faces with his homosexuality and identity as a black homosexual man, including the physical and emotional abuse he endures growing up.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Barry Jenkins
Director.Bio: Barry Jenkins is an American filmmaker whose work captures the essence of his tumultuous life.

Bio: Barry Jenkins is an Academy Awardss-winning director whose movies reflect his tumultuous upbringing.

Title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
Description: Set in France in the late 18th century, the film tells the story of a lesbian affair between two young women: an aristocrat and a painter commissioned to paint her portrait.

Genre.Name: Historical
Genre.Description: Historical fiction is a genre in which a fictional plot takes place in the setting of particular real historical events, paying attention to the manners, social conditions, and details of the period.

Director.Name: Celine Sciamma
Director.Bio: CÃ©line Sciamma is a French screenwriter and film director whose films capture the female gaze, fluidity of gender, and sexual identity.

Title: But I'm a Cheerleader
Description: A high school cheerleader's parents send her to a residential in-patient conversion therapy camp to "cure" her lesbianism, which fails dramatically.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre that consists of discourses or works intended to be humorous or amusing by inducing laughter, and may include elements of satire, dramatic irony, or taboo humor.

Director.Name: Emma Seligman
Director.Bio: Emma Seligman is a Canadian film director and screenwriter whose films focus on female relationships with sex.

Title: Everything Everywhere All At Once
Description: A Chinese-American immigrant, while audited by the IRS, discovers that she must connect with parallel universe versions of herself to prevent a powerful being from destroying the multiverse.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy is a genre of speculative fiction which involves themes of the supernatural, magic, and imaginary worlds and creatures.

Director.Name: Daniel Kwan
Director.Bio: Daniel Kwan is one half of an American filmmaking duo with Daniel Scheinert, whose careers started by making music videos.

Title: God's Own Country
Description: A young sheep farmer in Yorkshire has his life transformed by a Romanian migrant worker.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Francis Lee
Director.Bio: Francis Lee is an English filmmaker who never formally studied the subject, and who writes the films he directs.

Title: Carol
Description: Set in 1950s New York City, the story is about a forbidden affair between an aspiring female photographer and an older woman going through a difficult divorce.

Genre.Name: Historical
Genre.Description: Historical fiction is a genre in which a fictional plot takes place in the setting of particular real historical events, paying attention to the manners, social conditions, and details of the period.

Director.Name: Todd Haynes
Director.Bio: Todd Haynes is an American film director, screenwriter, and producer. His films span four decades with themes examining the personalities of well-known musicians, dysfunctional and dystopian societies, and blurred gender roles.

Title: Weekend
Description: Two men begin a relationship the weekend before one of them plans to leave the country.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Andrew Haigh
Director.Bio: Andrew Haigh  is an English filmmaker who was born in Harrogate and studied at Newcastle University.

Title: Ammonite
Description: The film follows a speculative romance between 1840s paleontologist Mary Anning and geologist Charlotte Murchison.

Genre.Name: Historical
Genre.Description: Historical fiction is a genre in which a fictional plot takes place in the setting of particular real historical events, paying attention to the manners, social conditions, and details of the period.

Director.Name: Francis Lee
Director.Bio: Francis Lee is an English filmmaker who never formally studied the subject, and who writes the films he directs.

Title: Shiva Baby
Description: A young bisexual Jewish girl attends a shiva with her parents alongside her ex and her sugar daddy.
